reviewText:
There are certain games that most everyone likes but just don't capture you for some reason. It's often not the fault of the game but just a bad marriage between game and gamer.

So it is with me and The Escapists. To be honest, I don't get it. There's no direction, the art style is best phrased as butt-ugly and the controls aren't easy. I'm forever getting stuck on the edge of doors because you have to be lined up perfectly to get through them. I don't find the gameplay very compelling.

I know what I'm supposed to do - work on your stats, get into a job that allows you to steal the components you need to escape and then do so - but I don't find it very engaging. In that I know I'm in the minority. That's ok. I'm just not good at it. The side quests are simple, the other prisoners seem to be fairly faceless, the routine dull and just the whole thing for me falls flat. I haven't even been able to escape the first prison and to tell you the truth it's not really worth my time trying. I should like it - I'm a fan of strategy - but I don't.

Now again, that's just my experience. But I also know I'm not the only one. A friend of mine also bought this and felt the exact same way. In the meanwhile the reviews are very positive, so I know and accept that I'm in the minority.

Yeah, if this sounds like the classic it's not you
recommended: it pretty much is. I'd probably like the game much more if the controls were better
hoursPlayed: if the graphics are clearer and if the strategy was more robust. But it's not and I regret buying this one. If returns were allowed when I bought it
voteText: I would have done so. But they weren't and so it gets a thumbs down from me. YMMV."

reviewText: So simple yet so much fun. Great concept, challenging gameplay and amusing dialogue from the guards and other inmates. You are dropped into the prison routine without much direction on how to escape. Read books, work out, build relationships, learn the map/routine and MacGuyver yourself some tools and weapons. There are different strategies and play styles for you to discover as you go along. The prisons are increasingly difficult and there are community-made maps and a map editor when they get boring.\n\nThis game is definitely worth the price, even when it's not on sale (but it's a STEAL when it is... get it? eh?)

reviewText:
***SPOILERS BELOW***
Tried the game some months ago, reached days 10+ twice and gave up. Just started it a few days ago, reached day 14 without any progress and started watching lets plays.

Some of the main tips I missed was:

* be there at roll calls to know who is gonna get a cell search (if you don't want to lose everything and go in the solitary every other day)
* forks can break walls, spoons can dig holes (makes escaping from earlier prisons much easier, when advanced items are harder to access)
* roll of duct tape can craft you a LOT of things (poster, cutters, pickaxe, shovel, contraband pouch, tying guards, and many more things)
After that and a lot of spoiling from let's plays I managed to escape the first three prisons in 5 hours. If you know all of that, it's just a matter of time and proper timing to finish the game. I kind of wish I tried it myself, but I can't even imagine how much time it would've took me if I tried to learn everything myself.
So I say don't feel stupid if you give up and want to read wikis on craft recipes and which does what, the game does not have that art style just to save on artist salaries, it is also a reminder that old games were hard as ♥♥♥♥ and didn't give you step-by-step on how to wipe your own ♥♥♥ and left you there wondering 'what the ♥♥♥♥ do I do now?'. The game truly is a masterpiece in that regard.

reviewText:
Games that expect you to use a wiki to figure everything out are not my thing, and the systems in this game are designed in a way that makes me feel gross.

You find crafting recipes or buy them with character-specific dollars, and your crafting recipes found" journal is per-character. This makes me feel like I have no progression because I want to start a new character if I end up hating the layout of the loot and how I've done on my current character and I always start from square 1 with the crafting stuff.

There is only one prison until you beat that first one
date: and beating the first one is a hell of a task. This means if you ♥♥♥♥ up on the first one 25 times and start to get sick of the exact same routines and level layout every time you are SOL unless you manage to beat it or play the other two
recommended: much harder prisons that are unofficial.\n\nThe fullscreen on 16:9 monitors is just the normal aspect ratio of the game stretched grossly wide
hoursPlayed: like an emulator set to stretch an NES game to 1080p that makes Mario twice as fat. It's really terrible and is the only option.\n\nThe emergent gameplay of the prison is minor and less deep than it seems at the outset. You can easily knock out any prisoner by hitting them once and then running them into a guard while they chase you
voteText: let them hit you once and then the guard beats them to unconsciousness. You can make people miss their quota for their job by beating them up a bunch during work hours and then take their job. You can plant contraband in their cells. You can make people hate you and then coax them into fighting you and use them to cause a distraction or go somewhere they wouldn't. These things are kind of cool. But not enough to base a game around.\n\nIf you fight a guard

Early Access Review

Saying this game is frustrating is an understatment.

You have sheets set up along your prison cell bars so they cant see in.
contraband hidden in the vents

Best game 9/10

Early Access Review

Best prison/escape simulator I've played so far. Don't let the screenshots tell you anything, its VASTLY improved since then in terms of prisons, art style and overall the complexity of it. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Escapists
After 28 hours of this game, I still haven't came anywhere NEAR escaping the prison.
Countless hours of gathering contraband items, and coming very close to escaping, all of that coming down to an early room search or accidentally going past a metal detector.

Graphics 8/10

The graphics aren't advanced in any way, but they are simple and it looks quite good the pixely way it is, giving it a nice feel.

Gameplay 10/10
It is, strangely enough, a very addictive game.
You can spend countless hours playing this game, and it doesn't really get boring, with the new updates nearly every week.

OverallOverall, The Escapists is a very well recommendable game. It is fun, simple to get the gist of, and most of all, not all that expensive! I very well recommend this game.

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

seriously, i love this game! simulators are cool to me but most of them are made to rage or are just plain normal. that's why i love goat simulator but most importantly, that's why i love this game! it's a pretty cool game and the guards are very realistic. i've never been in jail before but i'm pretty sure the guards act almost exactly like that. the game reminds me of the shawshank redemption (soz if spelt wrong, i don't know how to spell a couple of words) and it's pretty difficult to escape when the guards are breathing on you neck. the suspense is why i love stealth games. out of all the time i've played this game (not long) i haven't dicovered any bugs or reasons to hate this game! there are a couple of things missing but not enough to well and truly hate it. that's why i have a reccomendation list for what i think this game needs.

multi player: the game's AI is really good. but imagine how much fun one would have playing with ones mates.
workshop support: this game really needs the ability to make your own prisons.
cops and robbers mode: if you ever decide to implement multiplayer, there should be the option to become a cop.

i'll let you know if any more ideas come to me.
keep up with the good work! i really don't want to see this game disscontinued.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As an early access game, I am very impressed. This game has so much potential, and such a good immidiate response, that it could end up being a very in-depth and enjoyable game. Here are some of my personal recommendations.

More maps!  (Maybe even a map editor in later updates?...)
More crafting. As of right now there are still some items that dont do anything.
Better customization. Only very few characters are available as of now. It would be cool to see different characters with special abilities such as an engineer or a tank.
Slow down the deterioration of skills! Keeping all skills consistantly high and trying to escape at the same time is near impossible.
What after? I understand this game is all about escaping, but what after? an outside world? or could you have a stand-off inside prison against outside forces?
co-op or even   MULTIPLAYER  I'm certainly not the first or last to say this, but this game needs multiplayer.
This is a message to all modders and even game devolpers working on making this game better.

reviewText:
This has to be one of the funnest and most addicting games I have played in a while.

It is a very nice mix between a sandbox game, but also a stratagy.

I love how it makes you think, and there is many different ways you can escape the prison. Like for example you can start a prison takeover, or you can dig a hole underground to your freedom.

If you like games, that make you use your head and you know that every decision is game changing it could help you escape or set you back a few days. then this is a game for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty nice game, especially for an early access. There's a decent ammount of content as of now (and hopefully some more to come in the future), and i havn't encountered many technical issues yet, couple glitches here and there, but nothing that bothersome with maybe an exception or two. Considering this is an alpha, the ammount of bugs is quite low, and only few of them are actually impactful. You may mix up the controls as they can get a bit confusing at some points, but nothing broken, so it's fine. I had a few responsiveness issues, but it didn't bother me or alter the gameplay.

The Escapists feels pretty complete already, though more content, and a co-op mode wouldn't hurt. Seriously, a co-op mode would be incredibly fun in this, if it's done properly.

There isn't really any story in this but it's not important in this case, and the soundtracks as well as the art style (what do you expect, it's pixels) aren't very impressive, but they are not bad for sure, it's pleasant and fitting. The gameplay is the strenght of the game. Considering that it is an early alpha access, pretty much everything is subject to changes, so remember that.

Be warned though, it can get a bit repetitive and/or frustrating if you are out of luck.

Overall, a good mix of strategy, crafting, looting, earning money, pixel art, RPG, prison escaping, hidding mechanics, and a couple more things.

If the above sounds good enough to you, you may want to give it a try. I very much enjoyed it so far.

7/10 would recommend still would like to see a MP mode.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

seriously, i love this game! simulators are cool to me but most of them are made to rage or are just plain normal. that's why i love goat simulator but most importantly, that's why i love this game! it's a pretty cool game and the guards are very realistic. i've never been in jail before but i'm pretty sure the guards act almost exactly like that. the game reminds me of the shawshank redemption (soz if spelt wrong, i don't know how to spell a couple of words) and it's pretty difficult to escape when the guards are breathing on you neck. the suspense is why i love stealth games. out of all the time i've played this game (not long) i haven't dicovered any bugs or reasons to hate this game! there are a couple of things missing but not enough to well and truly hate it. that's why i have a reccomendation list for what i think this game needs.

multi player: the game's AI is really good. but imagine how much fun one would have playing with ones mates.
workshop support: this game really needs the ability to make your own prisons.
cops and robbers mode: if you ever decide to implement multiplayer, there should be the option to become a cop.

i'll let you know if any more ideas come to me.
keep up with the good work! i really don't want to see this game disscontinued.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty nice game, especially for an early access. There's a decent ammount of content as of now (and hopefully some more to come in the future), and i havn't encountered many technical issues yet, couple glitches here and there, but nothing that bothersome with maybe an exception or two. Considering this is an alpha, the ammount of bugs is quite low, and only few of them are actually impactful. You may mix up the controls as they can get a bit confusing at some points, but nothing broken, so it's fine. I had a few responsiveness issues, but it didn't bother me or alter the gameplay.

The Escapists feels pretty complete already, though more content, and a co-op mode wouldn't hurt. Seriously, a co-op mode would be incredibly fun in this, if it's done properly.

There isn't really any story in this but it's not important in this case, and the soundtracks as well as the art style (what do you expect, it's pixels) aren't very impressive, but they are not bad for sure, it's pleasant and fitting. The gameplay is the strenght of the game. Considering that it is an early alpha access, pretty much everything is subject to changes, so remember that.

Be warned though, it can get a bit repetitive and/or frustrating if you are out of luck.

Overall, a good mix of strategy, crafting, looting, earning money, pixel art, RPG, prison escaping, hidding mechanics, and a couple more things.

If the above sounds good enough to you, you may want to give it a try. I very much enjoyed it so far.

7/10 would recommend still would like to see a MP mode.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Escapists
After 28 hours of this game, I still haven't came anywhere NEAR escaping the prison.
Countless hours of gathering contraband items, and coming very close to escaping, all of that coming down to an early room search or accidentally going past a metal detector.

Graphics 8/10

The graphics aren't advanced in any way, but they are simple and it looks quite good the pixely way it is, giving it a nice feel.

Gameplay 10/10
It is, strangely enough, a very addictive game.
You can spend countless hours playing this game, and it doesn't really get boring, with the new updates nearly every week.

OverallOverall, The Escapists is a very well recommendable game. It is fun, simple to get the gist of, and most of all, not all that expensive! I very well recommend this game.

9/10

reviewText: The Escapists is a simple game with a lot of charm. The first point of business it has a wide range of tools and a new artistic design on graphics the graphics have been pushed to 2D wich in my opinion gives the game a unique style. The game is as it says in the title you have 5 (and two bonus prisons) wich grow increacingley harder in difficulty, the main aim is to go about the daily routine and in the spare time buy from other inmates the tools requerd to escape in multiple ways each distinctley with there own risks and rewards. The game is a fun twist on the life of an imaate and and entertaining way to waste away a sunday afternoon as you become stressed becauce you were so close to escaping when a guard discovers youre tunnel and robs you of youre tools or the patronising dicision to either wait another day and save or to risk loosing all of youre hard erned tools. however the game lacks in the lenth as each day can be a struggle as the ever repeating time table gets werey fast and for the most part yo must follow this. there is also recentley a map editoe wich gives the players an ability to make there own prisons on the steam workshop however fun this is this is just a beta and currentley has nimerus bugs and gliches but if you persevier it is well worth the effort.\noverall this game is worth a 7/10 this is becauce of the repetative timetable as it gets so boaring in the later stages thanks for reading my take and i hope i have helped you in youre decision to purchase this title. please comment if there is anything i have missed thanks.

reviewText:
So, I tried playing it again after leaving during Early Access.

After making butt loads of custom dialouge for my game (great change, btw) I actually got in and tried to beat the first Prison, Centerperks.

As far as I can tell, the only way to escape prison is at night. The end of the day. If you attempt an escape at day, you'll be insta killed by all-seeing snipes placed everywhere. And this is Minimum Security? Anyway...
My plan was to get a guard outfit using a contraband bag, crawl into the vents use my plastic utility key and make my way to the roof. I'd use a bedsheet rope to scale down the ceiling, and cut my way out.
This is my first time playing this game, remember. I forgot to make a bed dummy, and the guards found my empty cell.


So, I had to do the whole day over again, or have to do the entire escape plan over again.
The whole day. So it ended up becoming everytime I found something useful for my escape, I waited for the end of the day so if I got caught, I wouldn't have to buy it from the RNG merchants again. Like, getting the contraband bag was huge hassle. The guards came after me, I got beat up and they took my bag. I had to spend two in game days trying to find a merchant to sell me the damn materials because they sell different stuff each time.

Anyway! I failed my escape attempt, did the whole day over again. I went into the vents and was unscrewing the vent infront of the utility shaft to the roof. I would put down a stepladder to go back up and replace the vents so I wouldn't be teleported instantly to solitary confimement. (which is BS by the way. if they find anything wrong, you'll insta-lose and go to solitary and have to redo the whole day.)

So, I was unscrewing the vent, unscrewed it and BOOM insta-lose. There just happened to be a guard walking by and saw the vent go up. I just realized that at night, you can't see what's under the vents like you can at day. I had already tried this escape plan 3 times before. First time I got to the roof, but they discovered my empty cell. Redo the day. 2nd time I forgot to get my guard outfit because I had waited the whole day last time. Redo the day. Third time, a guard jsut happened to walk by.

So now, I have to hope that when I unscrew the vents, a guard wont walk by before I can replace it.
Or else I'll have to redo the day.


I AM SO SICK OF HAVING TO REDO THE DAY.
The day's are long and boring once your escape plan is in place. If you mess up, it just becomes waiting until night-time simulator.

This would all be fixed if I could quick-save. I'm a ♥♥♥♥ing noob at the game, and looking at walkthroughs for the first day" escape or whatever is
recommended: cheating.  Just let me quick save at night so I can try again. The people who are good at this game can do ironman mode or whatever but don't ♥♥♥♥ me.\n\nI got ♥♥♥♥ed so many times playing this game. If you wan't to buy this
hoursPlayed: make sure your plan is foolproof. How do you know it's foolproof? Either a)looking on the internet) (which I think is cheap) or b) trial and error). Trial and error

reviewText:
I watched Jacksepticeye and I saw it had a prison creator. I decided I should buy it, but only for the creator. Turns out I missed the fun game.

Until later.

I played it and instantly fell in love with it. I was a hoarder and I collected what I thought was cool (lighters, watches, etc.) One of my favorites was the teddy bear, but before I knew I could craft half the stuff I had could be useful I didn't find it. reviewText:
When I first saw this game, I instantaniously knew I had to get it.  An 8-bit strategy game invloving its own crafting system and all about escaping prison.  Yeah, perfect ingredients for a great game.

Some Positives Here:
-The crafting system is well designed and very simple (its just acquiring some of the materials that's the hard part).
-The mechanics of the prisons are varied, in terms on jobs, indoors/outdoors, security, etc.
-Diverse ways of getting out (some are exclusive to certain jails).
-Just all around fun

Of course not every game is perfect:
-I didn't like the update of having to complete sequential jails rather than just jumping right into one, I enjoyed occassionally jumping into Iron and realizing I have no idea what to do.
-Minor glitches, but mostly forgivable

But overall it's a great game and anyone thinking about getting totally should.

reviewText:
This game constantly keeps you on your toes as to where you store your red items. Red items are contraband and get you in trouble! While grinding skills is part of the game, the routine system discourages this so you've always got something productive to do, unless you wanna get in trouble.

Don't get this game unless you research prison life ahead of time through Jacksepticeye, videos in the community hub, or the wiki. It's important to know what's required of you, and the last thing you want to do is waste time, since time spent in the slammer is accounted into your final score.

I escaped Center Perks by cutting through the fence at night wearing a guard outfit after spending a few days bulking up to knock out a cop to replicate his key to get outside after Lights Out. I think for the next jail, I'll be digging a long tunnel under my desk because electic fences seem problematic.

10/10 would call the escape hotline to be notified of the electric fence again.

reviewText:
Developed by Mouldy Toof Studios The Escapists places you in the role of a convicted felon trying to escape from prison. Prison games aren’t the most original of ideas right now, but there take on it is quite unique. It’s currently out on Early Access on steam, so expect bugs and issue’s if you take the plunge. The game has an 8bit style that’s reminiscent of the games on the NES and gives the game a really stylised feel. The Escapists isn’t afraid to poke fun at its self too, you’ll often find yourself chuckling at the odd line a guard says or an awkward moment in the showers.


The main idea is of course to escape, but the game gives you a huge amount of choices on how to do that. Will you build a tunnel under ground, or pose as a guard? Will you climb into the ventilation system or chip through the walls? There is no set method and no dead set rules. But before you even think of escape there are other considerations.

Prison life starts in the morning with role call, this is where you will find out who’s cell will be tossed. If its yours I hope you’ve not left any contraband or signs of escape for the guards to find as this will set you back to square one again, you’ll lose all you’ve worked so hard to acquire and all your holes and false walls will be filled in.


After role call your day will be broken up into meal periods, exercise time, shower time and free periods/work periods. Through out the day you will be interacting with other inmates, buying items from them or taking jobs from them. These jobs range from acquiring for them a comb shiv to causing a distraction in the showers so your fellow inmates can dish out some rough justice. These jobs will improve your standing with said inmate and earn you money but might cause the victim to take a less positive view of you, eventually they may come looking for revenge. Guards that you’ve had run-ins with in the past might attack you on sight and leave you in the infirmary. You’ll find your constantly walking a popularity tight rope, it adds a nice dynamic to the game.

Your inmate has three skills that he can improve too, strength is the first. Improving strength with bench presses or push ups will increase your health. Speed is the second, this is improved by running on a treadmill or other cardio workouts. This skill is strange as it doesn’t improve your movement speed but rather how fast you can attack. Lastly is your intelligence skill, Improved by browsing the web or other knowledge based ventures. This improves what you can craft and is perhaps the most important skill in the game. You may want to take the time to improve these skills to keep you alive long enough to put you escape plan into action.


Don’t be fooled by the cute graphics or stylised charm of The Escapists, the game is not easy. It draws you in with a nice easy tutorial, but that’s it. After this you don’t get any help, your on your own. At times this can be infuriating, when you’ve been struggling for hours to put the perfect escape plan together only to be caught by a slight miss step. But! And its a big but, when you get it right its amazing. The game can be hard, but I can promises you that you’ll find yourself going back for more and more.

For full review see http://cyberusuk.com/2015/01/27/the-escapists-review-should-it-be-kept-behind/

reviewText:
Great game! 1 of my favourites, and also not very expensive! Also, more dlc's, the better (unlike most games where dlc's are crap). You can also now build your own prisons, add prisoner stashes, security perimeters, sniper towers, electrified fence that will fry you, and even a mobile vehicle! But, it takes quite a while to build a prison, aproximatly 0,5h-2h, not to mention editor been confusing and buggy. Game also lacks multiplayer, but makes up for it with workshop support (up to a point).

Long story short:

Pros:
- Great and fun game simulating prison escapes
- Cheap and great DLC's (I recommend them all)
- Prison editor and workshop! If you can't escape them, build them!

Cons:
- Prison editor is somewhat buggy and maybe complex a the beggining (NO coding)
- No controller support (sadly)
- No multiplayer, what really misses in this game

9/10 people

reviewText: The Escapists has a style of simplicity and the mechanics of complexity for an overall nostalgic feel. It brings the gamer back in time to a style of gaming that many has come to enjoy in their early childhood. This game also brings us to the world of prisons that not many games have touched. Live your fantasy in a prison and execute a plan from a wide array of items that you can utilize. There is so much to do; make friends and enemies as you try to escape your way through these prisons.

reviewText:
So, I tried playing it again after leaving during Early Access.

After making butt loads of custom dialouge for my game (great change, btw) I actually got in and tried to beat the first Prison, Centerperks.

As far as I can tell, the only way to escape prison is at night. The end of the day. If you attempt an escape at day, you'll be insta killed by all-seeing snipes placed everywhere. And this is Minimum Security? Anyway...
My plan was to get a guard outfit using a contraband bag, crawl into the vents use my plastic utility key and make my way to the roof. I'd use a bedsheet rope to scale down the ceiling, and cut my way out.
This is my first time playing this game, remember. I forgot to make a bed dummy, and the guards found my empty cell.


So, I had to do the whole day over again, or have to do the entire escape plan over again.
The whole day. So it ended up becoming everytime I found something useful for my escape, I waited for the end of the day so if I got caught, I wouldn't have to buy it from the RNG merchants again. Like, getting the contraband bag was huge hassle. The guards came after me, I got beat up and they took my bag. I had to spend two in game days trying to find a merchant to sell me the damn materials because they sell different stuff each time.

Anyway! I failed my escape attempt, did the whole day over again. I went into the vents and was unscrewing the vent infront of the utility shaft to the roof. I would put down a stepladder to go back up and replace the vents so I wouldn't be teleported instantly to solitary confimement. (which is BS by the way. if they find anything wrong, you'll insta-lose and go to solitary and have to redo the whole day.)

So, I was unscrewing the vent, unscrewed it and BOOM insta-lose. There just happened to be a guard walking by and saw the vent go up. I just realized that at night, you can't see what's under the vents like you can at day. I had already tried this escape plan 3 times before. First time I got to the roof, but they discovered my empty cell. Redo the day. 2nd time I forgot to get my guard outfit because I had waited the whole day last time. Redo the day. Third time, a guard jsut happened to walk by.

So now, I have to hope that when I unscrew the vents, a guard wont walk by before I can replace it.
Or else I'll have to redo the day.


I AM SO SICK OF HAVING TO REDO THE DAY.
The day's are long and boring once your escape plan is in place. If you mess up, it just becomes waiting until night-time simulator.

This would all be fixed if I could quick-save. I'm a ♥♥♥♥ing noob at the game, and looking at walkthroughs for the first day" escape or whatever is
recommended: cheating.  Just let me quick save at night so I can try again. The people who are good at this game can do ironman mode or whatever but don't ♥♥♥♥ me.\n\nI got ♥♥♥♥ed so many times playing this game. If you wan't to buy this
hoursPlayed: make sure your plan is foolproof. How do you know it's foolproof? Either a)looking on the internet) (which I think is cheap) or b) trial and error). Trial and error
voteText: however
helpfulPercent:
is punished.

SO WHAT THE FOUR HEART SIGNS AM I GONNA DO!?


How ever
votesHelpful: the game is still fun for other reasons.\nJust really wish it had quick saving."

reviewText: The Escapist is an awesome sandbox prison game where you take the role of a prisoner that you can name and choose a look. The game provides a tutorial, three save files, six challenging prison maps to escape, four DLCs, a whole community of map makers and the tools to make your own map with the additional Escapists: Map Maker (comes along with the purchase of The Escapists)\n\nStart off with daily routine and earn cash by doing jobs for the prison or for fellow cellmates, steal from guards and cellmates, craft dozens of unique tools and weapons, break open vents, dig underground tunnels, make gangs; whatever required to escape the prison! I highly reccomend it for those who love strategic games and crafting games. I'd give it 4 Stars and a 9/10. There still are some glitches like the NPCs getting confused when you sit in a seat the bots target to sit in at lunch and some just annoying things like the player immediatly getting sent to solitary while trying to escape. (guards should just come out and find the player if they are to be caught.) Developers should fix this but those are small details that don't ruin the entire game. They have gotten annoying to me though. Anyways 4 Stars/ 9 out of 10!

reviewText:
This game constantly keeps you on your toes as to where you store your red items. Red items are contraband and get you in trouble! While grinding skills is part of the game, the routine system discourages this so you've always got something productive to do, unless you wanna get in trouble.

Don't get this game unless you research prison life ahead of time through Jacksepticeye, videos in the community hub, or the wiki. It's important to know what's required of you, and the last thing you want to do is waste time, since time spent in the slammer is accounted into your final score.

I escaped Center Perks by cutting through the fence at night wearing a guard outfit after spending a few days bulking up to knock out a cop to replicate his key to get outside after Lights Out. I think for the next jail, I'll be digging a long tunnel under my desk because electic fences seem problematic.

10/10 would call the escape hotline to be notified of the electric fence again.

reviewText:
Developed by Mouldy Toof Studios The Escapists places you in the role of a convicted felon trying to escape from prison. Prison games aren’t the most original of ideas right now, but there take on it is quite unique. It’s currently out on Early Access on steam, so expect bugs and issue’s if you take the plunge. The game has an 8bit style that’s reminiscent of the games on the NES and gives the game a really stylised feel. The Escapists isn’t afraid to poke fun at its self too, you’ll often find yourself chuckling at the odd line a guard says or an awkward moment in the showers.


The main idea is of course to escape, but the game gives you a huge amount of choices on how to do that. Will you build a tunnel under ground, or pose as a guard? Will you climb into the ventilation system or chip through the walls? There is no set method and no dead set rules. But before you even think of escape there are other considerations.

Prison life starts in the morning with role call, this is where you will find out who’s cell will be tossed. If its yours I hope you’ve not left any contraband or signs of escape for the guards to find as this will set you back to square one again, you’ll lose all you’ve worked so hard to acquire and all your holes and false walls will be filled in.


After role call your day will be broken up into meal periods, exercise time, shower time and free periods/work periods. Through out the day you will be interacting with other inmates, buying items from them or taking jobs from them. These jobs range from acquiring for them a comb shiv to causing a distraction in the showers so your fellow inmates can dish out some rough justice. These jobs will improve your standing with said inmate and earn you money but might cause the victim to take a less positive view of you, eventually they may come looking for revenge. Guards that you’ve had run-ins with in the past might attack you on sight and leave you in the infirmary. You’ll find your constantly walking a popularity tight rope, it adds a nice dynamic to the game.

Your inmate has three skills that he can improve too, strength is the first. Improving strength with bench presses or push ups will increase your health. Speed is the second, this is improved by running on a treadmill or other cardio workouts. This skill is strange as it doesn’t improve your movement speed but rather how fast you can attack. Lastly is your intelligence skill, Improved by browsing the web or other knowledge based ventures. This improves what you can craft and is perhaps the most important skill in the game. You may want to take the time to improve these skills to keep you alive long enough to put you escape plan into action.


Don’t be fooled by the cute graphics or stylised charm of The Escapists, the game is not easy. It draws you in with a nice easy tutorial, but that’s it. After this you don’t get any help, your on your own. At times this can be infuriating, when you’ve been struggling for hours to put the perfect escape plan together only to be caught by a slight miss step. But! And its a big but, when you get it right its amazing. The game can be hard, but I can promises you that you’ll find yourself going back for more and more.

For full review see http://cyberusuk.com/2015/01/27/the-escapists-review-should-it-be-kept-behind/

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was slightly concerned about buying this game, but the price was reasonable and I wanted a game to play.

Best. Decision. Ever. Been playing for ages, stealing from desks at breakfast and working out. It's very addictive and I can't even figure out why! But I love it. I've always liked playing prison servers on Minecraft and this is much more fun than them. Anyone who's a fan of those kinds of servers should DEFINITELY get this game.

There is only one con I can think of, which is sometimes when I'm making my way to my job at the metalworks, I'll be walking down and guards will attack me for no apparent reason, even though I don't usually carry contraband. After they kill me I'll be walking back to my job and they'll be yelling at me to get back to work, which will increase my guard heat.

But overall it's a great game, and it's in Early Access so there's still loads to be added. I'm exited for any further release.

reviewText:
Great game! 1 of my favourites, and also not very expensive! Also, more dlc's, the better (unlike most games where dlc's are crap). You can also now build your own prisons, add prisoner stashes, security perimeters, sniper towers, electrified fence that will fry you, and even a mobile vehicle! But, it takes quite a while to build a prison, aproximatly 0,5h-2h, not to mention editor been confusing and buggy. Game also lacks multiplayer, but makes up for it with workshop support (up to a point).

Long story short:

Pros:
- Great and fun game simulating prison escapes
- Cheap and great DLC's (I recommend them all)
- Prison editor and workshop! If you can't escape them, build them!

Cons:
- Prison editor is somewhat buggy and maybe complex a the beggining (NO coding)
- No controller support (sadly)
- No multiplayer, what really misses in this game

9/10 people

reviewText:
The Escapists is an amazing game, with a fun style, great music, and loads of features.

Pros:
- Easy to understand how to play.
- 6 base maps, and then two extra ones outside of those.
- Map editor where you can create your own prison.
- Awesome background music.
- Challenging, yet feels great to escape.

Cons:
- Needs more duct tape.
- Needs more duct tape.
- Most importantly, NEEDS MORE DUCT TAPE!


(Also, key remap should be available after you enter a prison)

reviewText:
It took a while for me to get decent at this game, I spent like an in-game month on level 1 trying to figure out how to escape by trial and error. I ended up needing to look at the wiki for some recipes, because waiting untill you find a worthy crafting note takes way too much time.

Regardless of this, it's cool you can find your own way to break out, you could plan your whole evil masterplan to break out, or just use plastic cutlery to cut the fence on level 1 (which I later discovered). The great thing about this is that you kinda need to find a new way on each level, as it gets progressively harder.

The visuals are pleasing, audio is quite nice for a 2D game and I like the fact that gameplay-wise you can just take your time to observe your environment, get familiar with the prison schedule and you don't get punished by the game for taking your time and just following the prison guidelines.

Pros:
- Great difficulty curve (once you get familiar with the game)
- Custom levels and level editor (so you don't have to regret buying the game once you finish it)
- Pleasing graphics and good audio
- Controls are okay

Cons:
- May become repetitive after a while (Even with the level editor, but hey, everything gets repetitive eventually)
- Tutorial tends to overlook some stuff (like how to unlock crafting recipes, recruit prisoners, etc.)

Nevertheless, had tons of fun playing this game, I do recommend it for any 2D stealth/freeroam loving person like me.

A multiplayer/co-op mode would basically be heaven

Decent to strong 8

reviewText: The Escapist is an awesome sandbox prison game where you take the role of a prisoner that you can name and choose a look. The game provides a tutorial, three save files, six challenging prison maps to escape, four DLCs, a whole community of map makers and the tools to make your own map with the additional Escapists: Map Maker (comes along with the purchase of The Escapists)\n\nStart off with daily routine and earn cash by doing jobs for the prison or for fellow cellmates, steal from guards and cellmates, craft dozens of unique tools and weapons, break open vents, dig underground tunnels, make gangs; whatever required to escape the prison! I highly reccomend it for those who love strategic games and crafting games. I'd give it 4 Stars and a 9/10. There still are some glitches like the NPCs getting confused when you sit in a seat the bots target to sit in at lunch and some just annoying things like the player immediatly getting sent to solitary while trying to escape. (guards should just come out and find the player if they are to be caught.) Developers should fix this but those are small details that don't ruin the entire game. They have gotten annoying to me though. Anyways 4 Stars/ 9 out of 10!

reviewText: The escapists is a game where you break out of multiple prisons. each prison gets harder as you go on. Dont let the graphics fool you this is a fantastic and well made game. You well have to craft weapons and various tools too aid your escape. You can also buy tools from your fellow inmates. You can earn money by doing the job the prison has asigned you or you can get some quick cash by doing your inmates dirty work. You well need to keep it cool with the other prisoners or they might get angry with you and they might turn violent you also want to keep your repuation good with the gaurds becuase they can make your life misruble in the slammer. There is also DOWNLAODIBLE CONTENT in the WORKSHOP so you can always downlaod new prisons and maps if you get board. So over all i give this game a 7 out of 10 its a good game with nice game play mechanics and i highly recommend i.
